entry.title: Ukraine says 7 wounded in attack by armed group in western city
entry.summary:
MOSCOW - Ukraine's Interior Minister says four civilians and three police officers have been wounded in an attack by armed men whose weapons include grenades in a western city.

Mukhachevo is in far western Ukraine, near the border with Poland and Slovakia.

entry.title: Ukraine Says 7 Wounded in Armed Gang Attack in Western City
Ukraine's self-defense units look for the enemy within
entry.summary:
In this photo taken on Thursday, June 25, 2015, members of a self-defense unit carry out exercise drills in a location outside Odessa, Ukraine.

Odessa lies more than 500 kilometers (300 miles) west of the front line in east Ukraine, where government troops are mired in a war of attrition against Russian-backed separatists.

Ibrahim's background is a vivid illustration of the eclectic mix of interests encompassed by the movement that militates for Ukraine to develop closer ties with Russia instead of the West.

entry.title: Gunman kills 3 postal workers in Ukraine, steals $115,000
entry.summary: Both the government of Ukraine and its people have been under severe economic stress recently.

entry.title: Gunman kills 3 postal workers in Ukraine, steals $115,000
entry.summary: MOSCOW (AP) - An unidentified gunman shot and killed three postal workers Friday as they were transporting money in eastern Ukraine, escaping with the equivalent of $115,000, police said.

entry.title: Russia's Putin upbeat on Ukraine crisis solution
entry.summary: UFA, Russia Russian President Vladimir Putin said on Friday that there were more chances for Ukraine crisis to be successfully resolved rather than for it to fail.

entry.title: Romania: Italian foreign minister discusses Greece, Ukraine
entry.summary:
BUCHAREST, Romania (AP) - Italy's foreign minister has discussed the situations in Greece, Moldova and Ukraine with Romanian officials.

Iohannis and Gentiloni also talked about Romania's eastern neighbors, Moldova and Ukraine, which have both signed EU association agreements.

entry.title: European lawmakers condemn Russia's actions in Crimea, Ukraine
entry.summary:
Representing more than 50 countries, 96 lawmakers on Thursday condemned Russia's "unilateral and unjustified assault on Ukraine's sovereignty and territorial integrity."

Russia was absent from 40th anniversary meeting in the Finnish capital as its delegates were denied visas in line with the European Union's travel bans for Russia's actions in the Ukraine crisis.

entry.title: News24.com | Russia cuts off power supplies to Ukraine rebels
entry.summary: Ukraine's Energy Minister Volodymyr Demchyshyn said on Tuesday that energy-rich Russia had recently also stopped supplying electricity to the militia-run regions of Lugansk and Donetsk because bills were not being paid.

entry.title: Russia cuts off power supplies to Ukraine rebels: Kiev
entry.summary: KIEV: Kiev said on Tuesday that Russia had cut off electricity to Ukraine's rebel-run regions in what appears to be another sign that Moscow is losing interest in plans to splinter its neighbour.

entry.title: Dick Durbin letter to Ukraine PM may be Russian forgery
entry.summary: "Senator Durbin has been outspoken in his criticism of Russia's invasion of Ukraine and supportive of Ukrainian efforts to reform their economy and defend their nation," Durbin spokesman Ben Marter said.

entry.title: Correction: Russia-Ukraine-Gas story
Correction: Russia-Ukraine-Gas story
entry.summary:
FILE - In this Wednesday May 21, 2014 file photo, a gas pressure gauge in Bil 'che-Volicko-Ugerske underground gas storage facilities is seen in Strij, outside Lviv, Ukraine.

Russian gas company Gazprom halted supplies to neighboring Ukraine on Wednesday, July 1, 2015, after the collapse of pricing talks, company official said.

Gazprom CEO Alexei Miller said Russia stopped deliveries at 10 a.m. because Ukraine didn't make an advance payment for July's gas.

entry.title: Land mine explosion in eastern Ukraine kills 5 soldiers, wounds 3 as fighting grinds on
entry.summary: The United Nations estimates that the war in Ukraine has claimed about 6,500 lives since it broke out in April 2014.

entry.title: Land mine blast in east Ukraine kills 5 soldiers, wounds 3
Land mine blast in east Ukraine kills 5 soldiers, wounds 3
entry.summary: Despite an internationally brokered cease-fire in February, sporadic fighting continues along Ukraine's front line and each side regularly accuses the other of shelling its positions.

entry.title: Slovak agency: Russian spies increase activities in EU, NATO
entry.summary:
BRATISLAVA, Slovakia (AP) - Slovakia's spy agency says Russian agents have significantly increased their activities in Slovakia and all other NATO and European Union countries in connection with the crisis in Ukraine.

The SIS says Russia has been actively supporting the separatists in Ukraine to keep the country under its sphere of influence.

It says Ukraine's conflict strengthened the position of conservatives close to Russian President Vladimir Putin.

entry.title: NATO chief in Romania to inspect site where alliance to build facility in reaction to Ukraine
entry.summary: BUCHAREST, Romania - NATO Secretary General Jens Stoltenberg is meeting top officials in Romania and will inspect a site where the alliance will build a facility in reaction to the crisis in Ukraine.

entry.title: Russia halts gas supply to Ukraine amid pricing dispute
entry.summary: "Gazprom is not going to send gas to Ukraine at any price without the advance payment," Miller said in comments carried by Russian news agencies.

entry.title: Russia fails to reach deal on future gas supplies to Ukraine amid price differences
Russia Fails to Clinch Deal on Gas Supplies to Ukraine
entry.summary: The current dispute comes at a moment when gas consumption is low, allowing Ukraine to bargain for better terms.

entry.title: Russia fails to reach deal on future gas supplies to Ukraine amid price differences
entry.summary: The two countries have fought several gas price wars in past years, and gas disputes exacerbated after Russia's annexation of Ukraine's Crimean Peninsula in 2014 and a pro-Russian insurgency in eastern Ukraine.

entry.title: Russia fails to clinch deal on gas supplies to Ukraine
Ukraine says it may freeze debt payments to fund war
US compares China's south China Sea moves to Russia's in Ukraine
entry.summary: The US State Department's number two diplomat on Friday compared China's behavior in pursuit of territory in the South China Sea to that of Russia in eastern Ukraine.

entry.title: NATO fears return of escalated violence in eastern Ukraine - Obama discusses Ukraine, ISIS in telephone call with Putin
entry.summary: June 25, 2015: NATO Secretary General Jens Stoltenberg, second right, speaks with Ukraine's Defense Minister Stepan Poltorak, second left, during a meeting of the NATO-Ukraine Commission at NATO headquarters in Brussels.

entry.title: White House: Putin calls Obama, discuss Ukraine, IS, Iran
entry.summary: The call came on the same day NATO's supreme allied commander cited a continuous flow of ammunition and other military supplies from Russia across the border to Ukraine.

entry.title: White House: Putin calls Obama, discuss Ukraine, IS, Iran
entry.summary: Russian President Vladimir Putin and President Barack Obama spoke by telephone Thursday and discussed continued tensions in eastern Ukraine and the fight against the Islamic State in the Middle East.

entry.title: Vladimir Putin calls Barack Obama to discuss Ukraine and Islamic State
entry.summary: Putin, who has consistently denied backing the pro-Russian rebels in Ukraine, initiated the phone call with Obama, according to the White House.

entry.title: Putin not done in eastern Ukraine, NATO's top general says
entry.summary:
U.S. General Philip Breedlove, NATO's supreme allied commander, said the border between Ukraine and Russia was "wide open," allowing free movement of equipment and supplies.

Inside Ukraine, where pro-Russian separatists are battling Ukrainian forces, Breedlove said "we see a force that has been trained, that is led by Russian leadership, ... and is ready to do whatever mission is required of it in the Donbass (region)."

entry.title: EU extends sanctions against Russia by 6 months
entry.summary: An EU statement said the decision was taken without debate by the bloc's foreign ministers at a meeting in Luxembourg, in response to "Russia's destabilizing role in eastern Ukraine."

entry.title: Pope tells Putin: 'Sincere' peace efforts needed for Ukraine
entry.summary:
Russia accuses Ukraine of failing to launch political dialogue with the rebellious east and of keeping its economic blockade of areas controlled by pro-Russian rebels.

Federico Lombardi said their talks concentrated on the Ukraine conflict and the Middle East, where the Holy See is worried about the fate of the Christian minority.

entry.title: Killings of soldiers and civilians fray Ukraine's ceasefire
US Senator McCain slams European stance on Ukraine
entry.summary:
McCain has been a lively supporter of legislation passed in the U.S. Senate this week that includes provisions to supply Ukraine with hundreds of millions of dollars in defence military equipment.

KIEV, Ukraine (AP) - U.S. Sen. John McCain has said during a visit to Ukraine that it is shameful that Washington's European allies have not done more to assist Ukrainian forces in their quest to defeat Russian-backed separatists in the east.

The U.S. Senate this week approved a bill that includes provisions to supply Ukraine with $300 million worth of defensive military equipment.

Russia condemns U.S. military aid to Ukraine and says it will foment instability.

entry.title: One Ukrainian serviceman killed as eastern attacks intensify
entry.summary: The truce brokered by the leaders of Ukraine, Russia, Germany and France in Minsk, Belarus, has stemmed large-scale fighting but skirmishes claim lives almost daily on both sides.

entry.title: Ukraine says 6 servicemen killed in fighting
entry.summary: A Russia-backed rebel loads shells in a tank at Donetsk airport, eastern Ukraine, Friday, June 12, 2015.

entry.title: Caught in the middle: War in Ukraine creates no man's lands
entry.summary: FOR STORY UKRAINE NO MAN'S LANDS - In this photo taken on Thursday, June 11, 2015, local children play volleyball in the town of Severodonetsk, Luhansk region, eastern Ukraine.

entry.title: War in Ukraine traps suffering east in no man's lands as fighting trudges forward
entry.summary: A craze has swept through Ukraine for the removal of Lenin monuments, regardless of abiding fondness among many elderly people for the communist era.

entry.title: Caught in the middle: War in Ukraine creates no man's lands

entry.title: Caught in the middle: War in Ukraine creates no man's lands
entry.summary: KATERYNIVKA, Ukraine (AP) - A single crack of an automatic rifle shattered the tomb-like silence of this no-man's-land village in east Ukraine.

entry.title: Report: Ukraine renews license for under-fire TV station
entry.summary: KIEV, Ukraine (AP) " Ukraine's government broadcasting authority has extended the operating licensing for a popular television station that has been accused of a pro-Russia stance.

entry.title: Educated Ukrainians flee east Ukraine for new lives in Kiev
entry.summary:
The Ukrainian government never organized a proper evacuation from rebel-held areas, but it has taken pride in "evacuating" major universities - opening new campuses in Ukraine-controlled areas and inviting students and faculty.

In this Thursday, May 14, 2015, photo, Victoria Sosnina poses for a photo, during an interview in Kiev, Ukraine.

entry.title: Educated Ukrainians flee east Ukraine for new lives in Kiev
entry.summary: In this May 13, 2015, photo, Alesya Bolot gestures during an interview in Kiev, Ukraine.

entry.title: Educated Ukrainians flee east Ukraine for new lives in Kiev
entry.summary:
KIEV, Ukraine (AP) - Alesya Bolot worked for a contemporary arts foundation that converted an abandoned factory into a mecca for young and bright people with daring ideas.

According to the U.N., a total of 94,000 people from eastern Ukraine are now living in Kiev and its suburbs.

entry.title: Pope tells Putin: 'Sincere' peace efforts needed for Ukraine
entry.summary: Putin for his part stressed the price Italian businesses are paying for the economic sanctions lodged by the European Union against Russia, which annexed Crimea from Ukraine during the conflict.

entry.title: Pope Francis urges Vladimir Putin to commit to 'sincere, great effort' for Ukraine peace
entry.summary: The Vatican said the Pope told Mr Putin that it was essential to resolve the "grave humanitarian situation" in Ukraine, allow aid into conflict areas, and work for "progressive detente in the region".

entry.title: Pope calls for peace in Putin talks
entry.summary: Pope Francis has met privately with Russian president Vladimir Putin at the Vatican, using the talks to call for a "sincere and great effort" aimed at bringing peace to Ukraine.

entry.title: Pope tells Putin: 'Sincere' peace efforts needed for Ukraine
entry.summary:
Lombardi said Francis stressed the need "to commit oneself in a sincere and great effort to bring" peace to Ukraine, through dialogue and implementation of the Minsk accords.

Renzi greeted Putin as Russia's "dear" president and didn't voice any criticism against the country's actions in Ukraine, saying simply that they both agreed there must be full implementation of the Minsk peace accord.

They said sanctions against Russia won't be lifted until Moscow fully implements its part of the Ukraine peace accord, and could be increased if needed.
